entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model: What’s New as of 2025.09.01?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community!

Here comes some exciting updates to SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM).  In this post, I will walk you through the newest features and enhancements in SAP PaPM Cloud UM.

Let’s dive in.

Manage Environments

New “Validate” button in Manage Environments

To help modelers catch issues before activation, we’ve introduced a "Validate" action in the Manage Environments screen. 

  • Available for saved versions only 
  • Validates the entire model to check consistency 
  • Compiles the entire model to ensure all formulas and expressions are correct 
  • Starts immediately when you click Validate, and progress can be tracked via notifications and the event log 

This helps reduce activation errors by ensuring your environment is as clean and consistent as possible during design time. 

If the validation fails, don’t worry — it’s easy to track down what went wrong. Just head over to the Event Logs, open the relevant Validate log entry, and you’ll find detailed error messages to help you fix the issues quickly. 

Manage Model Entities

Model Entity support for dependent value help filters (compounds)

This feature introduces dependent value helps (compound filters), allowing one dropdown list to be dynamically filtered based on the value chosen in another field. For instance, the list of Facilities Consumption values can be restricted according to the selected Company, so users only see context-relevant options. This applies to relations with Validation Type = Value Help where a Default Filter is defined to specify dependencies (e.g., CostCenter depending on Company) using simple expressions.  

Once configured, the system automatically applies the filter during editing: dropdowns adjust in real time, only showing values that match the filter criteria and join logic. This not only prevents irrelevant or invalid selections but also improves accuracy, efficiency, and consistency across the model.  

If no default filter is defined, each field shows its full value help independently.   

Manage Model Currency Conversions

Need to convert one currency into another in your model? The Model Currency Conversion function helps you do just that — converting values based on current exchange rates, which means the result can go up or down depending on real-time fluctuations. 

Once a record is processed by a conversion rule, it won’t be re-checked by later rules, even if it still matches their conditions — this keeps things efficient and avoids conflicting results. 

Model Currency Conversion vs. Manage Currency Conversion: What’s the Difference? 

While both functions help with currency conversion, they work very differently under the hood: 

  • Model Currency Conversion 
    Once activated, this function creates an SQL view directly in your HANA Cloud tenant's database. It’s fast, lightweight, and doesn’t require procedures — results are delivered on the fly. 
  • Processing Currency Conversion 
    This one generates SAP HANA procedures that run to produce temporary data during processing. It’s more procedural in nature and is typically used for more complex processing flows. 

For more information on a Model Currency Conversion function, see Model Currency Conversion.   

Manage Model Unit Conversions

Working with data that comes in different units can be a real challenge—especially when you're combining information from different systems or sources. That's where Model Unit Conversion comes in. 

This feature helps you easily convert quantities from one unit of measure to another—like meters to kilometers or kilograms to pounds—all within the same measurement category. It ensures your data remains consistent and comparable, even when you're working with inputs from different teams, systems, or countries that use different measurement standards. 

But there are two types of unit conversion available in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Universal Model: Model Unit Conversion and Unit Conversion (processing function). While they both aim to solve the same problem, they work a bit differently under the hood. 

With Model Unit Conversion, once you've set it up and activated it, the system automatically creates an SQL view in the background. This means conversions happen on the fly, without needing to generate additional database procedures or store temporary data—making it a lightweight and efficient option. 

On the other hand, the standard Unit Conversion function behaves more like a processing task. When it's activated, it creates SAP HANA procedures that are run to populate and store temporary data records as part of the conversion process. So, it's more resource-intensive and used in different scenarios where preprocessed results might be needed. 

For more information on a Model Unit Conversion function, see Model Unit Conversion. 

 

Spoiler

Note on Standard SAP Conversion Tables  

SAP’s standard currency conversion tables like TCURR, TCURF, TCURV, T006 and T006D and others aren’t available out-of-the-box in the Cloud. But don’t worry — you have options:  

  • Connect to your ERP or S/4HANA system to access these tables virtually  
  • Or, manually create and upload the required tables and data into your HANA Cloud instance  

Manage Reader Functions

Reader Function Type "Delta" Support for OData Service and SAC Model Connections 

The Reader Function Type “Delta” now supports OData and SAC Connections. This enhancement allows users to filter and load data efficiently by retrieving only the records necessary from OData Services and SAC Models. 

When configuring a Reader Function Type “Delta” with SAC or OData connections that were created from the Manage Connections application, kindly note that the Delta related attributes (Delta From Parameter, Delta To Parameter, and Delta Field) are required. This will ensure that the system would be able to accurately identify and load the relevant data. 

For example, I have the following dataset from SAC which contains a total of 10 records. 

Now, I would like to retrieve only the records where the Count value is between 1 and 5. With this, our Reader Function Type “Delta” with SAC Connection can be maintained with the following Delta attributes (all of which are of Key Figure Type Integer): 

  • Delta From Parameter: CountFromParam (Parameter Field with Default Value = 1) 
  • Delta To Parameter: CountToParam (Parameter Field with Default Value = 5) 
  • Delta Field: Count 

After the Run of the Reader Function Type ‘Delta’ with SAC connection, only the relevant records based on the maintained Delta attributes will be loaded and visible in the Data Screen (Show Data). 

For more information on the  Reader function you may also check the Application Help for Universal Model: Reader.  

Manage Model View

Model View Type Projection with Materialization

When building models for complex business use cases, our goal is always to deliver flexible, scalable solutions that meet customer expectations. However, one technical challenge we've faced is the HANA limit on view nesting depth—a maximum of 128 levels. In large environments, especially when stacking many model functions, it’s easy to hit this limit, leading to activation errors like "error 369: exceed maximum view depth limit."

To work around this, we’ve often had to manually break long dependency chains by writing intermediate results to physical HANA tables using writer functions—an extra step that adds complexity and overhead to the process.

Now, we’re making this easier. We’ve introduced Model View Projection with Materialization, a new option that lets you generate HANA table functions instead of deeply nested SQL views. When enabled, this setting wraps your model view’s SQL query inside a table function. This effectively resets the query stack depth, allowing you to continue building complex models without hitting the nesting limit.

This change makes it possible to activate large environments more reliably, avoid manual workarounds, and better support the complex modeling needs of your business scenarios.

For further information on Model View with Type Projection with Materialization please check the Application Help for Universal Model – Using Universal Model – Function – Model View – Projection with Materialization  

Manage Connections

Managed Association Fields support for Connection type AddOn Environment and Model Reference

A new connection type has been introduced in the Manage Connection namely “AddOn Environment”. This new connection type allows you to fully integrate, connect, and consume all model entities with an Active API state from its target environment, such as Sample Content for Universal Model, to the environment you are modeling or the AddOn environment we may call.  

Using this connection type, you are adapting the configurations of the model functions (such as model entities) as well as their dataset, data control, and association fields are carried over to the new environment via the Model Reference function. 

The Model Reference function for this new connection type works mostly the same as the one used for Environment Connections, but it has stricter rules about the type of connection allowed. 

Why should we use an AddOn Environment Connection type?

  • It will enforce syncing of all Model Entities with API State Active, meaning all Model Entities with API State Active from target environment will be created on the environment you are modeling or the AddOn environment we may call, as Model Reference function. 
  • It will enforce syncing of all Environment Fields used in these Active Model Entities including association fields with the same name semantics.  
    • If there are Connection fields of type Association, for which no target exists in the environment you are modeling, it will be automatically adapted to characteristic fields. 
    • If there are Connection fields of type Association, for which the target exists in the environment you are modeling, it will be automatically adapted to association fields. 

For more information about the new connection type, please refer to Application Help for Universal Model: 

Creation of Connection Type AddOn Environment: Application for Business Users > Model > Manage Connections > AddOn Environment 

Created Model Reference function configuration: Function (Type) Configuration > Model Reference > AddOn Environment 

Manage Processes

Export and import Process Settings for mass creation

The new Export Settings and Import Settings buttons in the Manage Process screen are a big win — they help users save, share, and restore process setups without the hassle.

Instead of manually documenting everything, you can now export your process configuration with just a click. The Export Settings button becomes active when you select one or more processes and generates a CSV file that neatly captures all the details, including processes, activities, reader and writer teams, fields, parameters, and even layouts. This file is automatically saved as a process comment attachment for easy access and tracking.

Here’s a glimpse on how the exported file looks like when downloaded and opened.

If you need to reuse, modify, or create a setup, the Import Settings button makes it simple. Clicking it opens a dialog box where you can select from existing CSV attachments. Once imported, the system automatically updates the process name, teams, activities, fields, and layouts, saving time and reducing the risk of errors. Additionally, if the template value in the CSV doesn’t match any existing process, Import Settings will create a new one automatically.

Another helpful addition is the CommentCount field, which shows how many comments and attachments are tied to a process. Comments can be saved, filtered, or even deleted together with the process, keeping all related information organized and accessible. With these enhancements, you can spend less time worrying about process configurations and more time focusing on meaningful work. 

Add Custom Labels field to Processes

A new property in General Information section of the Process is available and that is Custom Labels which allows the Process Manager to maintain it with free text, which will later be used by the Report User to filter based on it.  

Let me use the Accounting Rules Engine (SARE2506) sample content as an example as it contains many processes. 

To maintain this as a Process Manager, go to the process itself and edit Custom Labels with the value suited for the use case. 

Later on, as a Report user in the Report create the Application Element of Type Processes and in the Filters you can apply the Custom Labels equals to the value set by the Process Manager. 

This can allow the Report user to filter out in Application Element of type Processes only the processes with this label. It leaves more flexibility to the users. 

Manage Activities

Alternative layout for "Manage activities" 

A new enhancement has been implemented in the Manage Activity application wherein it is now much easier and user friendly when viewing existing activities in the application. 

Previously, as a standard layout used in Manage Activity application, it displays all the existing activities in the system, then the user can search or filter the activity needed. With the new enhancement, the activities are now grouped by Process with both Process and Description sorted in ascending order as the standard layout. 

It displays the following columns by default based on the columns that will fit on the screen. 

  • Description 
  • State 
  • Data Screen 
  • Run Status 
  • Changed By 
  • Changed At 
  • Confirmed At 
  • Reader Team 
  • Writer Team 
  • Comments 
  • Data Locks 
  • Runtime Environment 
  • Process 
  • Enable Run 
  • Enable Draft Run 
  • Enable Confirm 
  • Enable Reject 
  • Enable Erase Data 
  • Enable Lock Data 
  • Enable Unlock Data 

In addition, although a default layout is applied when accessing the application, users can still create and update custom layouts based on their needs and set them as the default layout for the application.  

Consider Activity Fields and Activity Parameters from any Environment during Run Execution

In Manage Activities, you can now use activity fields, and parameters from any environment, not just the one where the activity was originally created.

Here’s what that means in practice:

  • Default values: If an activity doesn’t have any parameters or selections set in its current runtime environment, it will automatically use the default values.
  • Activity fields: Fields from any environment can be used in the activity and will be applied during execution.
  • Activity parameters: Parameters from any environment can also be used. If a parameter is provided, it overrides the default value defined in the activity’s own environment.

  • Logging: Every field and parameter used—no matter where it came from—is recorded in the Event Log.

This makes it easy to track what happened during execution and provides full transparency for audits or debugging. 

Manage Reports

Copy To Cross Environments

The “Copy to” functionality is a powerful feature designed to streamline report management across different environments within your SAP tenant. Whether you're promoting reports between development, test, and production environments or simply replicating standard templates, this tool provides an efficient and consistent way to do it. Here's what it offers: 

Multi-Report Selection 

Users can select one or more reports using checkboxes on the report list screen. Once selected, the “Copy to” action becomes available in the toolbar. 

Intuitive Environment Selection 

Clicking “Copy to” opens a pop-up window that displays all available environments within your tenant. Users can then choose the target environment where the selected report(s) should be copied. 

Full Report Replication 

Once the target environment is confirmed: 

  • The entire report(s) is copied 1:1, including all pages, content, and settings. 
  • This ensures consistency and eliminates the need for manual re-creation. 

Audit and Traceability 

  • Every "Copy to" action is logged via a dedicated event: copyReporsToEnv. This enhances transparency and makes it easier to audit changes and movements of reports across environments. 

The “Copy to” feature is a vital enhancement for teams working in multi-environment SAP landscapes. It simplifies report migration, ensures accuracy, and supports governance through built-in logging. Whether you're working in development, staging, or production, this tool helps maintain report consistency at scale. 

 For more information about Manage Reports, check SAP Help Portal à Manage Reports – Copy to  

Detail data display for show element in Reports in pivot mode

Last month we introduced a powerful enhancement —Detail Data Display in Pivot Mode in Data Screen. This new feature gives you deeper insights into your data by allowing you to explore the individual records behind aggregated values directly from the pivot screen, since understanding what contributes to your KPIs is just as important as seeing the number itself. With this enhancement, you no longer have to guess where figures come from—you can now see the exact detail records that make up any aggregated value, right from the report view. In June, we released the same feature for Show Elements. 

How it works: 

  • When users configure a Show Element in Pivot Mode, key figures appear as clickable links. 
  • Hovering over a value highlights it as interactive. 
    • Clicking on a key figure: 
      • Opens a second Show Element (a detailed list view) at the bottom of the screen. 
      • The detail panel loads only the records contributing to the clicked figure. 
    • Applied filters include: 
      • Story, page, and show screen filters 
      • Dimension values from column labels and row groups 
  • The correct aggregation logic (SUM, AVG, etc.) ensures the total of the detail records matches the clicked key figure. 
  • A vertical slider between the two panels allows users to resize, collapse, or expand the detail view. 
  • Layout state is saved 

This powerful enhancement makes it easier to trace, verify, and analyze numerical summaries by drilling into their source-level records—directly in your workflow, without disruption. 

Text cell in app elements - improve readability for long texts

Quickly read long texts without resizing columns in Application Elements of Reports. When you hover over  text, the full content now appears in a floating preview window.  

How to use 

  • Move your cursor over any truncated cell text → a preview window opens with the full value 
  • Move the cursor away → the preview closes 

Notes 

  • The preview reflects the cell’s current content 
  • Available by default; no configuration required 

Hide technical fields in Application Elements

Technical fields such as IDs, timestamps, and user references in Activities, Processes, and Event Logs are now hidden by default in the App Elements UI. This change was made to reduce distractions and keep the interface focused on business-relevant data. A new toggle switcher allows you to easily show or hide these fields whenever needed, giving you a cleaner view while keeping technical details accessible. 

User should see the following technical fields managed by the toggle in Processes and Activities: 

  • ID 
  • createdOn 
  • createdBy 
  • changedAt 
  • changedBy 

User should see the following technical fields managed by the toggle in Event Logs: 

  • Log ID 
  • createdOn 
  • createdBy 
  • changedAt 
  • changedBy 

Tabs in page content

We’ve introduced the ability to insert tabs directly in the page editor within the Report screen. This enhancement helps you better organize report content, making it easier to structure and navigate complex reports. 

With this improvement, you can: 

  • Create new page tabs within a report. 
  • Rename tabs to reflect the content or purpose. 
  • Delete tabs when they are no longer needed. 
  • Add content inside each tab to keep related information grouped together. 
  • Save your report with all tab changes preserved. 

This feature gives you more flexibility to design reports that are clear, modular, and easier to maintain. 

Citations for file upload

The Joule QnA Bot now shows sources for answers also based on uploaded documents, including the file name and page number, so you can quickly verify the source and trust the accuracy of the response. For paginated files like PDF or DOCX, citations appear with both the file name and the exact page used, while for formats without reliable page data (like Excel or PowerPoint), only the file name is shown. This update ensures consistent, clear, and reliable source references without disrupting the existing design. 

Add column menu option to set sort by text/value for fields with master data

A new Sort By menu has been introduced, allowing you to control how values (IDs) and descriptions of data records are ordered within a column. 

Available options: 

  • Displayed Value – sorts the data based on the default display order. 
  • Value – sorts the data by the field’s ID value. 
  • Text – sorts the data by the field’s description. 

The Sort By setting is now independent of Text Arrangement. You can decide how the text is displayed (e.g., value only, text first, text last) and still sort the column separately according to your chosen criteria.  

Add Activities tab to Reference Dialog and Dynamic environment code in reference link

The “Show Functions” option has been renamed to “Other” in the Set Reference dialog. Along with this change, you can now create references not only to Functions but also to Activities. When selecting an Activity under Other, the system generates a link with the correct activity_id that opens the corresponding Data screen. 

In addition, the Environment field has been improved: instead of showing a fixed environment code when the dialog opens, it now displays “Environment of Report”, making the context clearer. You can still change it to another active environment if needed. 

Extend dynamic Reference Link Dialog with link to Process

You can now set up dynamic links from page elements or tiles that take you directly to specific processes in your environment. 

When configuring a link, just open the "Other" tab — you’ll now see a new "Process" dropdown. This lets you choose from all available processes in the selected environment. You can pick from environments used for reports or any other environment available to you. 

Once a process is selected, a link is automatically created that takes you straight to the Process Object Page in Fiori. That means when users click on the page element, they’re taken directly to the right place — no extra navigation needed. 

Spoiler
Note: To set a reference link, make sure you are in Edit Mode. After selecting the process and setting the link, do not forget to save the report before navigating to the Process Object Page - the link will not work until it is saved.

It’s a simple way to make your pages more interactive and seamlessly connected to your processes.  

Model Screen

Runtime Model Screen

When you're working with the Model Screen, the "Show Runtime Model" toggle controls what kind of data you see: 

  • If it's turned off, you're viewing the design-time model — this means you're seeing data as it's defined in your project setup (like from Environments, Fields, Functions, and so on). 
  • If it's turned on, you're looking at the runtime model — this reflects what's happening when the application runs, pulling data from RuntimeEnvironments, RuntimeFields, RuntimeFunctions, etc. 

Keep in mind: these runtime entities (technically named sap.ace.Runtime*) are read-only. So while you can explore them, you can’t make changes directly from the Runtime Model screen. 

Search capability in Show Model to display function connections

The Search feature in the Model Screen isn’t just about finding names — it helps you understand how everything is connected. 

When you search for a term (like a function name, field, or environment), the tool doesn’t just highlight that item. It also shows you the connections and relationships between functions and other elements. This is incredibly useful when you're trying to: 

  • Trace how data flows through your model 
  • Understand which functions are using or calling each other 
  • Get a quick overview of dependencies without manually digging through everything 

Show Screen

Text Arrangement for Data Screen Fields via UI (and Environment Fields)

This new feature gives users full control over how association fields are displayed in the UI. Whether you're optimizing for clarity, consistency, or just personal preference—this enhancement is here to help. 

You can now define the Text Arrangement for association fields directly in the Edit Column dialog window on the Data Screen. 

In the Standard Layout (note: this feature can only be saved in this layout), open the Edit Column dialog by clicking the pencil icon next to a column name in the list shown after clicking the “Columns” pin. 

then you can: 

  1. Rename the column title (e.g., Business Area) 
  2. Select your preferred Text Arrangement from the dropdown: 
    1. Value Only – e.g. FA002 
    2. Text First (default) – e.g., Functional Area 002 (FA002) 
    3. Text Last – e.g., FA002 (Functional Area 002) 
    4. Text Only – e.g., Functional Area 002 
  3. Save the changes in the environment by ticking “Store globally in environment” checkbox. Please note that changes in the environment will be reflected in Standard Layouts first.  

Key Details 

  • Default Display Logic: 
    If no annotation is provided, Text First is used automatically. 
  • Scope of Effect: 
    The setting applies only to the Data Screen and does not affect: 
    • Value help (dropdown menus) 
    • Backend data 
    • Technical field values 
  • Global Storage Option: 
    A checkbox “Store globally in environment” is available for users with roles: 
    • PROCESS_ALL, PROCESS 
    • Not available to PROCESS_READ, ACTIVITY, or other read-only roles 
  • Pivot Mode Compatibility: 
    Your selected text arrangement will also be applied in Pivot Mode, ensuring a consistent experience across views. 

Reminder: Make your changes in Standard Layout, and then save them as a new layout to activate the feature.  

Data Screen column label group expand and collapse with sub-totals

We’ve added a powerful new way to interact with your Data Screen layouts—making it easier to navigate complex column structures and focus on the insights that matter most. 

You can now expand and collapse column label groups—just like row groups—within the Data Screen and Show Elements on Report Pages. This feature is especially useful for users dealing with hierarchical data (e.g., Level 1: Profit Center > Level 2: Business Area) and large sets of key figures. 

  • Expanded View: 
    See all nested column values (e.g., Business Areas under a Profit Center) and their corresponding key figures. 

  • Collapsed View: 
    Hide detailed columns and instead view an aggregated subtotal column for a clean summary view.      

  • Subtotal Behavior Configuration: 
    Choose how subtotals for Level 1 are displayed per column label: 
    • Show totals always in addition to data per Level 2 label 
    • Show totals only when collapsed (default) 

Save Layout State: 
Your expand/collapse preferences are saved with the layout and automatically restored the next time you access it. 

Where You’ll See This 

  • In the Data Screen (Show Data in Functions and in Activities) 
  • In embedded Show Elements on Report Pages 

Display as with options from column menu-> Text Arrangement with relevant options

This update provides a consistent experience across the application and adds the “Value Only” option, giving users more flexibility in how data is displayed. 

Column Menu Option “Display As” is now named “Text Arrangement” with following options on how to display data in Application Screens: 

  • Value Only – display only field ID. 
  • Text Only – display only the field description. 
  • Text First – display the description followed by ID. 
  • Text Last – display ID followed by the description. 

Display currency in total & subtotal cells

We improved the logic for displaying totals and subtotals in Show Data and Report Show to handle currency and unit consistency more clearly.

  • Consistent Groups:
    When all rows in a group share the same currency or unit, the aggregated value is displayed together with that currency/unit.
    Example: 1,250.00 EUR
  • Mixed Groups:
    When rows contain different currencies or units, no aggregate is shown. Instead, the cell displays “-”.

This enhancement ensures that totals and subtotals remain transparent, avoiding confusion when different units are involved and giving users a reliable view of group-level results.

Sankey & Chord charts in Data Screen / Show Elements

You can now create Sankey and Chord charts directly from your data to better visualize flows and relationships between entities. 

To create these charts in Show Screen: 

  1. Go to Show Screen. 
  2. In the Columns pane, unmark all fields. 
  3. Add at least two characteristic fields into Row Groups and a key figure into Values using drag-and-drop to Group Data 
  4. Right-click at least two row groups and select Create Advanced Chart From All Rows. 
  5. Choose one of the new chart types:
    • Sankey: A linear chart showing the flow of quantities between categories.  
    • Chord: A circular chart showing relationships between entities.  

Note: When creating one of these charts for the first time, make sure the selected row groups are expanded. 

This functionality is also available for Show Elements in Reports, with charts that can be fully configured, saved, and restored as part of your layout. 

Manage Archives

Exclude User Information from Demo Data Archive Files

When sharing demo data from the Universal Model, it's critical to ensure that no internal or sensitive user credentials are exposed—especially in collaborative or public environments. To address this, we've introduced a key enhancement to the Archive Demo Data functionality that allows for optional anonymization of user-related fields during export.

In the Archive Demo Data action, you’ll now find an additional field : “Anonymize Data”. This new value help gives you control over whether user information should be anonymized when exporting demo data files.

When “Yes” is selected, this excludes or anonymizes the _createdBy and _modifiedBy fields, which typically contain user identifiers that may link back to internal credentials or development users.

To maintain backward compatibility and avoid unexpected changes to current workflows, the “Anonymize Data” option is set to false by default. This means that unless explicitly enabled, the exported data will continue to include user data as before.

This feature is especially useful when demo data is being shared outside your organization—for example, in client demos, public sandboxes, or training environments—where privacy is important. 

Manage Tenant Settings

New "test mail_destination" button on Manage Tenant Settings screen

A new feature is introduced that allows users to test the subscriber’s subaccount destination (mail_destination) of the SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model. Using this feature will send an email notification without the need to configure any process templates and/or initiate a process activation or reset. 

In Manage Tenant Settings application, a new button is added which is the “Test mail_destination” 

Using this button, allows you to define the recipient of the test email and define a subject of the email to be received by the recipient.

  • “To:” – is a mandatory field where you can define a valid email address on who will be the recipient of the test email notification. 
  • “Subject” – this field has a predefined template “Universal Model Testmail via Destination mail_destination” that you can use to send the email notification. This can be still customized depending on the subject you want to send.  

 I know that this release contains many enhancements/features but if you still are curious about what came before? You can always check out earlier What’s New blog posts by exploring posts under the PaPMCloudUMWhatsNew tag.

That is all for now. Until the next blog post!!!

entry.title: Re: Introducing the SAP Fiori Development Portal: Your Gateway to Rapid SAP Fiori App Creation (1 of
entry.content: @KatSwan16  Yes, you’re right—the SAP Fiori Development Portal is focused on SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. For the business user perspective, we’re always working towards a consistent user experience for both OData V2 and V4. From an implementation perspective, both versions differ. Therefore, the portal’s options are available only for OData V4. Thanks for pointing that out—I’ll make sure to clarify this in the blog post!

entry.title: Re: User ID for IAS users
entry.content: Depends on if you want to govern via IPS or request attributes upon login via SSO. Each Cloud system is different, and you need to provision users (to create and delete them) and give them rights (either via provisioning, or upon login via federation).

entry.title: File Format and Extension Mismatch Error for Excel Attachment Sent via SAP ABAP (SOST)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are facing an issue with a custom SAP ABAP program that generates an Excel file and sends it internally via email through the SAP system.


When we check the sent email in SOST, we see the attachment, but trying to open the Excel file results in the following error:

“File format and extension of [filename] don’t match. The file could be corrupted or unsafe. Unless you trust its source, don't open it. Do you want to open it anyway?”

We suspect there might be a problem with how the file is being created or attached in the ABAP code, but we are unsure how to resolve this.


Has anyone encountered this issue before or can suggest best practices for generating and sending Excel files from ABAP to avoid this error?


Any guidance or code examples would be greatly appreciated.


Thanks in advance!

entry.title: passing prompt values from a story to a data insight
entry.content:
Hi all,

I don't know if I'm overcomplicating things, but I can't for the life of me get a working script to pass variable values from a story to an insight.
The story consumes a live model using the same BW query as the Data Insight - ergo the prompts are identical.
I simply want script in a button that will launch the Insight and pass the calendar prompt values to the insight....
Needs to be dynamic as the story prompt values obviously may change at each refresh.

Any help much appreciated as I fear I'm going down complex script rabbit holes.

entry.title: 🟡 Fun for Week 3: Puzzles, Puzzles, Puzzles 🧩📝
entry.content:
As we do each Devtoberfest, we have published an all-new and improved SAP Cryptic Crossword. And ... we have 3 additional puzzles -- including new types of puzzles -- to challenge you even more.

SAP Cryptic Crossword Puzzle

The centerpiece of the 2025 puzzles is again the SAP Cryptic Crossword. Just go to the crossword tutorial and you can complete it there: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-sap-crossword.html

The tutorial has some guidance on how to solve cryptic crosswords, but feel free to ask for help in this blog post.

👉TIP: Best to print out the grid and clues, solve it, and then enter the answers in the tutorial.

There is also a bonus puzzle where you have to take some of the letters in the completed puzzle and derive the name of 2 of our esteemed Developer Advocates: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-sap-crossword-bonus.html

How an ex-CEO of SAP saved the day

I'm going to tell a story about embracing failure, laughing at yourself, and learning from your mistakes. But ...

🚨🚨🚨SPOILER ALERT - I will spoil one of the answers of the SAP Cryptic Crossword, so skip this section if you don't want to have that clue spoiled.

When I first started creating the puzzle, I had this area of the puzzle that needed a clue/answer:

Since the puzzle focused on developers, and I was quite familiar with SAP Build Apps functions, I thought of the function CIEL(), which rounds a number to the next integer. Perfect! I even had a really good clue.

Command to round up horrific lice

 Well, I gave the puzzle to @qmacro to test. And besides being able to complete it in what seemed like 5 minutes, he found an embarrassing error -- I HAD MISSPELLED THE NAME OF THE FUNCTION!! The function was CEIL() not CIEL()!

I literally cursed out loud when I saw the mistake 😠.

Well, it was quite difficult to somehow make the function's real name fit and to move the puzzle around. So I searched for another answer that would fit. And the first thing I thought of was BILL, as in the name of our former CEO (also a word contained in some of our business processes). Bill McDermott was the longest-serving CEO during my tenure at SAP.

And that's how Bill McDermott saved my puzzle.

Scramble Puzzles

I am a big reader of Games magazine, since high school. And one of the simpler but fun puzzles is one where you have to find 10 words by taking each one's clue, removing one letter and then rearranging the remaining letters to form a new word. And then you have to figure out the common denominator of all those words.

Here's one from a recent issue. Try it.

So I decided to create my own for Devtoberfest, one related to programming languages and one related to the Event-Based Processes CodeJam that I do with my good colleague @ajmaradiaga.

  • Scramble, Programming Languages: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-fun-scramble-languages.html
  • Scramble, Event-Based Processes CodeJam: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-fun-scramble-codejam.html

Admission: Not that difficult to make 

It is pretty easy to create these puzzles. You take an online Scrabble word finder app -- I use this one, https://scrabblewordfinder.org/. 

Let's say you are doing a puzzle on fruit, and you start with a possible answer like apple. You search for any word with those letters plus any other letter by adding a question mark.

Then you look for a word that looks the least like apple. Here, I would say upleap. And that's all you have to do.

entry.title: CPI: OData v2 PATCH request includes key in body
entry.content:
I'm creating an iflow using the OData v2 adapter to connect to S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 (on-premise) using the SalesOrder (A2X) API package. The iflow needs to update a Sales Order with a delivery block.

For this I'm using a PATCH request. This request is automatically configured through the wizard fetching the metadata from the S/4HANA server:

The payload data is set via a message mapping taking the values from exchange properties, being mapped to the XSD generated from the above PATCH configuration:

Given that 'SalesOrder' is the key field it is marked as mandatory in the EDMX and a value is required.

The problem I'm facing is that the query going to S/4HANA correctly has the key field in the url, but also (incorrectly) in the body:

request:
PATCH /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrder(SalesOrder='123')

body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<A_SalesOrder>
  <A_SalesOrderType>
    <SalesOrder>123</SalesOrder>
    <DeliveryBlockReason>50</DeliveryBlockReason>
  </A_SalesOrderType>
</A_SalesOrder>

To which S/4HANA responds: "Key field SALESORDER must not be changed.". This error is correct according to the OData specification mentioning that key fields should not be part of the body. This is also confirmed by the API docs: "You must always provide all key fields in the URL to identify the entity." A simple test case without that field in the body goes through fine.

I know that I can easily get around this by using custom logic etc, but I'm looking for a clean, out-of-the-box solution.

Is there a specific configuration in the OData v2 adapter to make it remove key fields from the body for patch calls? Removing the field from the 'Fields' setting does not make a difference.

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud - Create a custom Data Product based on a replication Flow
entry.content:
• 1- Create aSAP HANA Data Lake Files(HDLF) Space in Datasphere
  • 2- Create a replication Flow from your source (in this blog we'll use SAP S/4HANA) to the created HDLF Space.
  • 3- Create Data Provider Profile in Datasphere
  • 4- Create and list a Data product
  • 5- List the Data product
  • 6- Share the Data product from the BDC cockpit.
  • 7 - Check the Data Product in SAP Databricks
  • Summary

In this Blog, we'll demonstrate how to create a custom data product from a replication flow that can be delta-shared with SAP Databricks or BDC connect.

There are few steps to follow:

1- Create a SAP HANA Data Lake Files (HDLF) Space in Datasphere

2- Create a replication Flow from your source (in this blog we'll use SAP S/4HANA) to the created HDLF Space.

3- Create Data Provider Profile in Datasphere

4- Create and list a Data product

5- List the Data product

6- Share the Data product from the BDC cockpit

7- Check the Data product from the BDC cockpit

1- Create a SAP HANA Data Lake Files (HDLF) Space in Datasphere

From the space management, you need to create a new space (HDLF)

This step can be skipped if you already have an HDLF space.

Once the space is created, you need to establish the connection to the source system (supporting replication flows) that you need.

2- Create a replication Flow from your source (in this blog we'll use SAP S/4HANA) to the created HDLF Space.

Once the space an the right connection are done, we can start creating our replication flow=

For this scenario, I will use the CDS view I_CUSTOMER:

As you can see, I enabled Initial and delta, so my data product well be refreshed as soon as a delta is loaded (it may take some refresh time to be reflected on the data product)

As a result of this replication flow, I will get a local table :

 

This table will be the source of our Data Product.

3- Create Data Provider Profile in Datasphere

In this step we need to create our data profile provider.

Data Sharing Cockpit -> My Data Provider Profile -> Create Data Provider Profile

You can follow this help page to create your Data Provider Profile: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/e4059f908d16406492956e5dbcf142dc/4d298f8654fe4a6c9b6a4399a9e14c77.html

In Order to be able to share the data product within BDC, you MUST set the "Data Provider / Data Product Visibility" to Formations.

 

Now, you will be able to create Data Products.

4- Create and list a Data product

In this step we'll use our Data Provider Profile to create the Data products.

Data Sharing Cockpit -> My Data Products -> Create Data Product

 

This link is helpful to create the Data Product: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/e4059f908d16406492956e5dbcf142dc/bbcbf42b0cb541529e63628d95f394c8.html

 

But Here are some of the important field that you need to fill:

  1. Artifact Space: the HANA Data Lake File space created in the first step and used for replication
  2.  Data category: you need to choose a category of your data product. In this example, I choose "Company Data"

  3.   Product Artifacts: Here is where we add our local table to the data product.

 

You have the possibility to add multiple tables to your data product.

You will see the added artifacts to your DP.

Last, you need to save the changes for your data product.

 

5- List the Data product

After saving the Data product, you will be able to see your DP like this:

 

In order, to share the DP within BDC you need to List your DP :

  • Switch Status -> List

The status will change to:

The Data Product will be available in the BDC cockpit after the next synchronisation job is done

6- Share the Data product from the BDC cockpit.

Now we will switch to the BDC cockpit.

From the menu we Navigate to "Catalog & Marketplace" -> Search

 

And we can search for our Data Product " CustomerDataP"

From here we can share our Data Product and see it's lineage.

- Share -> Add Target :

 

- Choose your target(SAP BDC or BDC Connect), In this Scenario, we'll choose SAP Databricks:

Then we add a Share Name : "customerdp", specify the Workspace in SAP Databricks, and Share

Once shared, you will se a notification telling you so.

7 - Check the Data Product in SAP Databricks

In this step we'll check our shared data product in SAP Databricks.

From the previous screen, once the shared is completed we can open our data product in SAP Databricks:

In SAP Databricks' Catalog, we can see our shared data product

From here we can visualize a sample data :

 

From here, it is up to your creativity in Databricks 😉

 

Summary

In this blog, we saw how we can create custom Data Products in SAP business Data Cloud. We started from a creating a replication flow in Datasphere to a HANA Data Lake File space, we created a Data Provider Profile that allowed us to created a Data Product from the local table (result of the rep flow). Then we were able to list tha data product so we can find it in the BDC cockpit catalog and finally share it with SAP Databrick.

 

I hope this will help you create you custom data products from Datasphere.

Kind regards,

entry.title: How does the field documentitemprocessingmode behaves on BAdIs
entry.content:
Hello,

We're are using VA01 or SOAP API to create sales orders, and we're trying to use the field documentitemprocessingmode as an indicator for our custom logic implementation. We've tried different BAdIs and we've noticed the desired field behaves differently:

  • SD_SLS_CHECK_ITEM: on creation, the value of the field is CHANGE.
  • SD_SLS_FINALIZE: the field documentitemprocessingmode cannot be accessed at all.
  • SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM: the field documentitemprocessingmode has the value CREATE, the expected by us.

How does this field works? What value can we expect on document creation?

Best regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How does the field documentitemprocessingmode behaves...
entry.content:
Hello,

The field documentitemprocessingmode value is set based on the field SVBAP-TABIX. If SVBAP-TABIX = 0, the item processing mode is CREATE, if it's > 0, than the processing mode is CHANGE.
The field documentitemprocessingmode is changed as soon as the item has been added to XVBAP[], that is, as soon as it has been related to the sales order. So even on the creation of the item, the mode is CHANGE, because it's only CREATE before the item is related to the sales order.

This field is not available on the BAdI SD_SLS_FINALIZE because it wouldn't be meaningful: at the time the BAdI is executed, the field svbap-tabix is always > 0.

Kind regards.

entry.title: Test Automation Solution for PO7.5 to SAP Integration Suite Migration
entry.content:
Test Automation Solution for PO 7.5 to SAP Integration Suite Migration

Enterprises are transitioning away from legacy SAP Process Orchestration (PO) towards SAP Integration Suite as PO approaches end of life. While this migration promises better scalability and integration capabilities, it also brings a significant challenge of ensuring data consistency and integrity throughout the process without disrupting business users.

In any migration project, testing can consume around 40% to 50% of the overall effort if done manually. Manual testing is time-consuming and prone to human error. Complex interfaces, multiple test cases, and large volumes of data drives up the time and cost of testing. Thoroughly validating that the new environment behaves as expected is critical to a successful transition. This is where automated testing solutions comes into play, simplifying and accelerating the validation of migrated interfaces.

 We have built a test tool to extract, compare, and validate payloads between your legacy PO system and SAP Integration Suite. This tool simplifies and automates testing of migrated iFlows, making your transition smoother, faster, and more reliable.

Key Features of Our Test Automation Tool

  • Automates payload extraction from SAP PO 7.5: Extracts input and output messages from your existing PO environment. It establishes connectivity with the PO System and pulls the payload for testing.
  • Validates test cases directly against migrated flows in Cloud Integration : Run test scenarios on the target platform(SAP Integration Suite) to verify correctness of migration.
  • Compares output payloads across systems: Detect any mismatches or errors.
  • Supports various testing approach: Whether testing single or multiple interfaces, Our tool adapts to project needs. It supports regression testing.
  • Generates detailed, downloadable test reports: Gain visibility into test results with comprehensive  reports.
  • Alerts via mails in case of failures: Immediate notifications enable quick corrective actions.
  • Supports standard adapters.
  • Monitoring through quality management and governance dashboard.

Whether you are migrating a few interfaces or hundreds, test tool brings efficiency, visibility, and reliability to your testing process saving both time and cost.

Integrating our test automation tool into your migration strategy will help with:

  • Faster testing cycles that reduce the overall migration timeline.
  • Improved reliability with consistent, repeatable automated test runs.
  • Greater visibility into testing outcomes through detailed reports.
  • Enhanced confidence that migrated interfaces behave exactly as expected.
  • Scalability to handle migrations involving just a few interfaces or hundreds.

Ready to accelerate your PO migration testing during migration? Reach out to learn how our tool can simplify your migration from PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite and save time, reduce costs, and ensure a smooth migration.

entry.title: Re: Query on Price Determination and Error Handling Durin...
entry.content:
You need to go for an enhancement to achieve this requirement. For that explore Workflow and BAdI validation.

Implement a workflow rule that checks the contract validity date against the current date. If the contract is expired, the workflow can:

  • Prevent PO approval.
  • Route the PO for manual review.
  • Trigger a warning or error message.

Use BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_FLX_PROCESS or similar (if available in Public Cloud) to inject custom logic during PO creation. You can validate:

  • Whether the contract referenced is still valid.
  • Whether the PIR price is being used despite an expired contract.

So with the above, the recommended approach is combine workflow validation + BAdI logic to enforce contract validity checks. Ensure that contract reference in PO is mandatory, and that the system checks its validity during creation. Optionally, use Fiori apps like “Manage Purchase Contracts” to monitor and proactively update expired contracts.

entry.title: Re: Using T.code ME2ON User able to create multiple deliv...
entry.content:
One option is you can try with BAdI: MB_DOCUMENT_BADI or ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST. These BAdIs allow custom logic during PO processing or goods movement. You can implement a check to:

  • Query existing deliveries for the PO item.
  • Prevent creation of a new delivery if one already exists.

The other option is maintain a custom flag or Z-table to track delivery status per PO item. Before allowing delivery creation, check this flag and block if already delivered.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights
entry.content:
To get an overview of my personal highlights, you are welcome to share a few minutes and watch my highlight video below.

In the sections that follow, we’ll explore how these intelligent capabilities are enabling transformation across your ERP operations. 

 

 

Unleashing intelligence: SAP business AI and Joule AI agents at the forefront

Finance: Streamlining account receivables with Joule agent

In the area of Finance, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of the Joule agent for Accounts Receivables, contributing to financial management by streamlining overdue receivables analysis. Acting as a virtual assistant, the agent swiftly identifies overdue payments, provides detailed summaries, and recommends actionable next steps, transforming traditional analysis into strategic decision-making. It offers comprehensive insights into outstanding balances, open invoices, and disputes, empowering finance teams to improve cash flow management and reduce risk. This innovation allows accountants to focus on proactive financial strategies, enhancing operational efficiency. Stay tuned for the general availability release of this game-changing tool.

For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

Supply Chain: Optimized warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning

Speaking of the Supply Chain area, SAP Cloud ERP Private's AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning is enhancing warehouse operations by addressing labor shortages and rising delivery demands with greater confidence. Imagine your warehouse managers equipped to forecast short- and mid-term workload changes using both historical and real-time data. This innovative solution allows for precise planning of resources and workloads, improving efficiency in managing outbound delivery orders.

The tool provides seamless access to interactive charts and key performance indicators (KPIs), helping managers to monitor, analyze, and anticipate labor demand. Integrated with SAP Smart Business, it leverages AI to offer forecasts on planned and future workloads, enabling supervisors to better plan shifts, enhance transparency, and minimize potential delays. As a result, businesses boost customer satisfaction by ensuring timely delivery fulfillment.

 For more details on this solution, visit the SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

Service Management: Equipment insights with Joule

In Service Management area, gaining a 360° view of equipment life cycles can transform your operational approach. With Joule integration, managers can assess equipment details, warranty information, and active service transactions, gaining insights into both customer and vendor warranties. AI-generated summaries capture the nuances of parts replaced and recurring issues, while offering recommendations for proactive management. This depth of information empowers service managers to make informed decisions, streamline operations, and enhance overall equipment effectiveness.

For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement: Purchase requisitions with AI-powered assistance

In the Sourcing and Procurement space, we are happy to introduce AI-assisted self-service requisitioning, simplifying the way purchase requisitions are created. Imagine casual users effortlessly engaging with Joule, an intuitive assistant that streamlines data entry and intelligently interprets misspelled information. This makes the requisition process accessible and user-friendly, eliminating the need for extensive navigation through multiple interfaces. Beyond just simplifying data input, Joule also leverages advanced language processing to understand and facilitate requests in diverse user languages, enhancing accuracy and efficiency. As a glimpse into the future, speech recognition promises to further reduce complexity, while simultaneously supporting purchasers by identifying sources of supply swiftly and minimizing reliance on free text items.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Sales: Resolving sales order fulfillment challenges with AI assistance

In the sales area, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces an AI-assisted sales order fulfillment process with Joule, designed to seamlessly address delivery, invoice, and supply challenges. Imagine having an assistant that not only identifies but explains the intricacies of fulfillment issues, spanning incomplete data, credit holds, billing discrepancies, and trade compliance blocks. As questions arise, Joule provides clear, AI-generated explanations of interconnected issues, displayed in an intuitive carousel format. Beyond resolving queries, it supports inquiries about supply chain and invoicing problems, as well as journal entry creation, making the entire process more transparent and manageable. This innovative tool streamlines sales operations, ensuring smoother transactions and greater clarity.

For further insights, explore the SAP Help Portal.

Now, let’s explore further innovations of the current release across various lines of business.

 

Turning data into value: A unified data foundation with SAP Business Data Cloud

In today’s enterprise landscape, data is the engine of transformation. With SAP Business Data Cloud, organizations can unify and govern their most valuable data – across SAP and third-party sources – enabling real-time insights and smarter decisions at every level. 

 

A unified data foundation for every business need

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 delivers seamless integration with SAP Business Data Cloud, providing a governed, harmonized data layer that supports analytics, planning, and AI-driven innovation. This foundation breaks down silos and ensures that leaders have access to trusted, business-ready data. 

For more information, consult our page on integration with SAP Business Data Cloud.

Industry-ready data products

The release introduces a broad set of data products tailored for diverse business scenarios:

  • Convergent invoicing: Data products for billing requests, plans, and documents enable near-real-time analytics and interactive dashboards.
  • Contract accounting: Rich data products for contract accounts, provider contracts, and accounting documents support deeper financial analysis.
  • Subscription management: Data products for subscription orders, contracts, and agreements provide actionable insights for recurring revenue models.
  • Manufacturing: Unified manufacturing data – such as production orders, confirmations, and work centers – empowers leaders to optimize operations. Eager to learn more on manufacturing data products? Consult our SAP Help portal.
  • Product lifecycle management: Enhanced data products for bills of material, engineering change masters, and change records drive better product and change management. For more information, click here.

 

From data to action: Working capital dashboard

A standout example is the working capital dashboard for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. By leveraging harmonized data from finance, procurement, and supply chain, this dashboard gives finance leaders real-time visibility into cash flow, receivables, and payables – enabling proactive, data-driven decisions to optimize working capital.

 

SAP Business Data Cloud is not just a technology layer – it’s the strategic enabler that turns data into value, powering the next wave of business transformation.

 

Strengthening the core: Innovations in business applications

 

Finance

Taulia: Contributing to cash flow and supply chain resilience 

Additionally, SAP Cloud ERP Private's integration with SAP Taulia benefits cash flow optimization and supply chain resilience. By leveraging real-time data insights, businesses enhance cash management and strengthen supplier relationships, allowing precise management of early payments and discounts. This boosts liquidity, enabling reinvestment in growth while maintaining supply chain stability. The integration streamlines financial processes, fostering transparency and a robust dialogue between buyers and suppliers. Empowered to manage cash flow proactively and reduce risks, organizations achieve greater agility and resilience.

 For more insights, explore SAP Help Portal.

 

Supply Chain

Streamlining order management with aATP Innovation

The current release introduces important enhancements to the Advanced Available-to-Promise (aATP) capabilities, designed to make order management more intelligent and efficient. These capabilities aim to instill confidence in order confirmations while simultaneously reducing inventory carrying costs, delivering tangible business benefits from the outset.

Picture a business environment where timely delivery is key to customer satisfaction and brand reputation. The new features enable companies to confirm orders with confidence, capitalizing on advanced backorder processing. This flexibility allows users to bypass traditional constraints such as Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL), and Supply Protection (SUP). As a result, businesses can reliably and accurately fulfill customer needs, ensuring the loyalty that comes from dependable service.

The innovation further streamlines logistics by automating transport order creation, facilitating the smooth movement of stock from substitute locations to the requested site. This automation reduces the need for manual intervention, minimizing errors, and promoting a seamless logistics process. Imagine the operational relief this brings, letting companies dedicate resources to strategic tasks rather than repetitive logistics management.

By introducing efficient availability checks for configured and long products, businesses achieve effective inventory management. This ensures readiness aligns perfectly with demand, paving the way for higher fulfillment rates and precise delivery dates, enhancing overall customer satisfaction.

Additionally, we are happy to introduce the Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation, a feature designed to streamline and improve logistical processes. This innovation allows businesses to consolidate shipments by ensuring that sales order items ship from the originally requested location rather than alternative stock-holding sites. This is particularly beneficial in maintaining a consistent supply chain, reducing the chances of logistical errors.

In the context of international shipping, this feature proves invaluable. It ensures goods are consolidated at locations best suited for tariff and tax declarations, thereby facilitating smoother, compliant export processes. Companies can navigate complex export requirements more confidently, knowing that their logistical operations support rather than hinder compliance.

 

Activation of this feature is notably flexible, accommodating various sales order characteristics. It automates stock reservations and generates necessary transportation documents as the orders are saved, reducing the manual workload associated with these tasks. This automation enhances the accuracy of transportation planning and scheduling, ensuring that these tasks align perfectly with business needs.

Eager to learn more? Consult this dedicated page  on SAP Help portal.

 

Service Management

Enhancing internal logistics: Optimized management of in-house service objects

Additionally, we are introducing a noteworthy advancement with the intracompany logistics feature for in-house service objects. This functionality empowers businesses to efficiently manage service objects within the same company code, enhancing logistical operations and resource utilization. It allows for the seamless transfer of an in-house service object between plants or storage locations, utilizing existing customer stock effectively. This capability not only optimizes space and resources but also streamlines internal logistics processes, ensuring service objects are handled with increased precision.

Businesses can now define and display the plant and storage locations of service objects, providing clearer visibility and control over inventory management. Furthermore, receiving service objects is made more efficient through the introduction of options to receive them directly via inbound delivery. This directly addresses the need for improved logistical coordination within companies, facilitating a more synchronized workflow when handling service objects.

Choosing between customer stock B and returns order stock E offers flexibility in how service objects are managed based on specific business requirements. The graphical process flow provides access to logistics-related documents, helping users quickly ascertain the status and movement of service objects. Additionally, receiving service objects at specified plant or storage locations, and reviewing their current location on the UI, enhances day-to-day operational efficiency and accuracy.

For more details, explore the SAP Help portal.

 

Driving agility: Real-time service management with enhanced service transactions

In today's dynamic business environment, flexibility is paramount for companies looking to stay competitive. In the current release, we introduce one more subtle yet powerful enhancement to service management area: the integration of plant and storage location fields within service transaction items. This advancement isn’t just a technical upgrade; it's a strategic lever for businesses aiming to enhance their operational agility.

Imagine a scenario where your company needs to rapidly adjust service delivery due to sudden market changes or resource constraints. With these new capabilities, changing the plant and storage location directly in service transactions becomes seamless, enabling you to adapt your logistics in real-time. This flexibility means that resources can be reallocated swiftly, improving response times and aligning services more closely with customer expectations.

Such adaptability transforms how businesses manage their logistics, turning service operations into a strategic advantage rather than a mere necessity. The ability to dynamically adjust service parameters according to evolving business needs not only streamlines processes but also ensures that service delivery remains efficient and customer-centric.

To dive into further details, don’t hesitate to explore the SAP Help portal page.

 

Asset Management

Streamlined maintenance strategies: Enhancing asset health

In the realm of asset management, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of enhancements with Maintenance Planner and Maintenance Order Management, integrating seamlessly with Joule to improve how maintenance is orchestrated. Consider a planner working hand-in-hand with an intelligent agent, dynamically analyzing real-time data to fine-tune maintenance schedules and improve asset health. Joule leverages technical object details to create maintenance planning buckets, offering planners a clear view of upcoming events and enabling seamless assignment of orders and notifications. Additionally, by checking available slots and reserving production capacities for future operations, downtime is minimized, fostering a more proactive maintenance approach. This integrated system not only optimizes workflows but empowers teams to make informed decisions, ensuring that assets remain in prime condition.

For more details, explore the SAP Help Portal.

 

Optimizing asset management: Tailored efficiency in maintenance operations

In the asset management landscape, SAP Cloud ERP Private enhances the “Manage Maintenance Orders” app to empower businesses with greater efficiency and customization. Imagine a streamlined operation where you effortlessly customize fields and processes to fit your unique needs. This app now allows batch editing of maintenance orders and the inclusion of multiple task lists, simplifying complex workflows and maximizing resource utilization. Picture the ease of linking business partners directly to orders, ensuring transparency and fostering stronger collaborations. This enhanced visibility ensures smoother communication and stronger partnerships, ultimately leading to improved service delivery and outcomes.

Interested to learn more? Click here!

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement

Precision in procurement: Elevating efficiency with synchronized service timelines

In the context of SAP procurement, timing is everything. SAP Cloud ERP Private’s latest enhancement allows for seamless transfer of lean service start and end dates to connected backend systems, shifting the focus from traditional delivery dates to precise service durations.

Visualize a scenario where procurement teams can boost efficiency significantly by having accurate service timelines at their disposal. This synchronization ensures that everyone, from procurement officers to backend users, operates with the same timeline data, reducing discrepancies and enhancing planning accuracy. With this new capability, businesses gain a strategic advantage, as coordinated planning between departments becomes the norm rather than the exception.

Think of the impact on your business: with synchronized service data, your teams can efficiently coordinate with service providers, ensuring that every commitment is met with precision. This results in improved operational harmony and more reliable partnerships. This innovative feature boosts your procurement efficiency, aligning strategic objectives with everyday operations. For more details on how this can transform your processes, explore the linked page.  

 

Sales

Enhancing sales efficiency with one-step-payment

In the ever-evolving landscape of digital commerce, SAP Cloud ERP Private now empowers businesses to streamline their sales processes through pre-order payments. This innovation allows customers to make payments even before a sales order is created, seamlessly integrating payment details into the sales order via an API. By carrying over liability and payment details to the finance application, businesses can efficiently match liabilities against payments, simplifying settlements and reducing days sales outstanding (DSO). This enhancement not only enhances liquidity and reduces financing costs but also appeals to customers who prefer paying upfront, offering a more flexible purchasing experience. Furthermore, it facilitates faster incoming digital payments, reassuring customers with the stability and responsiveness of a modern finance system.

Want to learn more about Payment Processing? Check out our SAP Help Portal.

 

Manufacturing

Seamless production alignment with advanced MRP solutions

In a quest to enhance operational efficiency, we are introducing innovative features for Material Requirements Planning (MRP) in Manufacturing area. The Accept MRP Run Result functionality allows production planners to flag specific segments as processed, streamlining decision-making by focusing on issues that truly need attention. This improvement, coupled with the ability to use a new filter field, empowers end users to efficiently analyze material coverage for thousands of materials daily, marking a significant enhancement in workflow efficiency. Additionally, the Manage Material Coverage app now offers rescheduling proposals, enabling planners to realign MRP elements by rescheduling or canceling as necessary. These real-time adjustments ensure that manufacturing requirements are always met as planned, minimizing disruptions and maintaining smooth production flows. With the option to invoke or revoke MRP results, businesses gain flexibility in their planning processes, adapting swiftly to changing demands. Ultimately, this upgrade facilitates a more agile and responsive manufacturing environment, ensuring that production aligns seamlessly with demand predictions.

 

For more details, explore the our dedicated pages on accept planning result of MRP run and rescheduling proposals for MRP elements.    

 

Cross Topics

Enhancing business engagement through integrated communications

With the current release, SAP Cloud ERP Private improves organizations’ ability to craft and deliver personalized, traceable communications seamlessly within their existing workflows. This innovation ensures consistent and timely interactions with business contacts by setting up automated, multi-step communication flows that operate both regularly and in response to specific events. By allowing ad-hoc communications directly from the current process step, businesses maintain critical context without ever leaving the system. This not only enhances productivity and transparency but also significantly boosts customer satisfaction by providing tailored communication that meets the unique needs of each business partner. With these capabilities, organizations can foster stronger relationships industry-wide, ensuring every message is delivered effectively and efficiently.

 

For more insights, please refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Elevating master data governance with Joule copilot

In the quest for seamless data management, SAP introduces an innovation that empowers business users to engage with business partner data through natural language dialogs in Joule Copilot. This advancement provides a consumer-grade user experience, simplifying the processes of searching, displaying, creating, and modifying data within SAP Master Data Governance. By integrating this intuitive interaction capability, users can effortlessly participate in master data processing, enhancing both their effectiveness and the overall speed of data governance. The automation and ease of use offered by Joule Copilot significantly elevate the handling of business partner data, allowing businesses to maintain accurate and timely records with minimal effort. This innovation stands as a testament to the commitment to user-friendly technology that aligns with modern business needs.

 Simplifying process check complexities with Joule copilot

Moreover, the integration of Joule copilot, helps tackling the complexity of the data governance processes by laying bare with the simplicity of natural language dialog. From now on, users can seamlessly search for and display governance processes in cloud-ready mode, including vital approval information. There's no need for extensive training or additional tools, business users can now harness advanced functions within SAP Master Data Governance intuitively. This empowerment transforms how teams interact with data, enabling them to make informed decisions swiftly and accurately. By simplifying the understanding of governance processes, businesses can ensure compliance and streamline operations.

 

Improved user experience: Seamless navigation with WalkMe integration

Imagine having a virtual guide that not only navigates the complexities of SAP Cloud ERP Private edition but boosts efficiency and confidence. Integrating WalkMe with SAP Cloud ERP Private improves user engagement by offering intuitive in-app guidance akin to a personal assistant, easing the learning curve for new users. This seamless interaction accelerates software adoption, reducing training time and automating repetitive tasks for heightened efficiency. As users navigate system upgrades or new processes, WalkMe’s role-specific guidance ensures confidence and competence, thereby transforming potential challenges into manageable steps. By providing actionable insights into user behavior, WalkMe empowers users to resolve issues independently, which enhances IT efficiency and reduces support demands.

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud – F2 billing: Number range inter...
entry.content:
Not sure whether you checked or not. If not, go to Define Number Ranges for Billing Documents in the production system and manually verify that the interval 19 has valid “from” and “to” values. In Public Cloud, number range intervals are not always transported correctly from the quality system to production. Even if the interval exists in your source system, the “from” and “to” numbers might be missing in the target system.

If Flexible Billing Document Numbering is active, the system may dynamically select a number range based on header fields (e.g., company code, billing type). If the logic points to a number range that’s not properly defined or missing, you’ll get this error. Check if flexible numbering is active and review the logic/rules in the configuration environment.

Even though number range key 00 exists, it must be defined for the specific fiscal year. Double-check that the number range for key 00 is maintained for the current fiscal year in the posting company code.

entry.title: Company Structure Overview and duplicate objects displayed
entry.content:
Let's start by defining our Company Structure, usually we find the Business Unit as the highest level in the hierarchy, followed by the Divisions and the rest of the structure is defined using parent child department relationship.

In this scenario our department object will have 2 associations one to division and another one to parent department. 

Because the Company Structure overview relays on the associations to display the structure, the department will be displayed twice, once under the division and another one under the parent department.

Department configuration

Let me show you a workaround to avoid this duplication

1. Add a custom field - division on Department object. this field should be read only

2. We create a Rule triggered on Save on Department object, that automatically populates the data from the standard association field to the new custom_division field in case the Parent department value is null

The custom division field should only be updated in case the Parent Department is not empty

3. Update the Company Structure Overview to display the new field instead of standard association

4. Go to Company Structure Overview and display the results. The Department no longer appear duplicated

5. Position and job info filters to departments will remain the same

Hope this can make your Company Structure easier to set up and maintain 

Please also take into consideration the useful information and configurations shared on IDP ( implementation Design Principle) IDP Employee Central Core Hybrid - Organization Structure Design Consideration V2.0.pdf

This IDP will provide you also more clarity on the set up and design of the Organization Structure

entry.title: Re: How to enable smart link with Action CDS view tile
entry.content:
Hello @Raghavendar 

In addition to @Maciej__Galica  comment,

You cannot restrict the Smart Link popover to a single action. By design, it lists all target mappings for a semantic object
To navigate directly to the Manage G/L Account app, use intent-based navigation via DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation instead of @Consumption.semanticObject.

Useful SAP Documentation References

Smart Link popover behaviour (lists all actions):

  • SAP Fiori Design Guidelines – Smart Link
  • SAPUI5 API Reference – sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink

Intent-based navigation annotations:

  • SAP Help Portal – ABAP CDS: DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation

Target app reference:

  • SAP Fiori Apps Library – Manage G/L Account Master Data (V2) (App ID F0731A)


Smart Link is a popover with an unlimited number of actions. Use DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation with General Ledger Account/manage for a straightforward, one-click access to Manage G/L Account.

With kind regards

Chuma
